title.raw: 《樂毅列傳》 Biography of Yue Yi

sentences.zh: 樂毅者，其先祖曰樂羊。

translations.literal: Yue Yi, his ancestor called Yue Yang.
translations.idiomatic: Yue Yi's ancestor was called Yue Yang.

sentences.zh: 樂羊為魏文侯將，伐取中山，魏文侯封樂羊以靈壽。

translations.literal: Yue Yang served as Wei Wen Hou general, attacked took Zhongshan, Wei Wen Hou enfeoffed Yue Yang with Lingshou.
translations.idiomatic: Yue Yang served as general for Wei Wen Hou, attacked and took Zhongshan, Wei Wen Hou enfeoffed Yue Yang with Lingshou.

sentences.zh: 樂羊死，葬於靈壽，其後子孫因家焉。

translations.literal: Yue Yang died, buried at Lingshou, his later descendants thus made home there.
translations.idiomatic: Yue Yang died and was buried at Lingshou, and his descendants thereafter made their home there.

sentences.zh: 中山復國，至趙武靈王時復滅中山，而樂氏後有樂毅。

translations.literal: Zhongshan restored state, to Zhao Wu Ling Wang time again extinguished Zhongshan, yet Yue clan later had Yue Yi.
translations.idiomatic: Zhongshan was restored as a state, until Zhao Wu Ling Wang's time when Zhongshan was again extinguished, and the Yue clan later had Yue Yi.

translations.literal: Yue Yi's ancestor was named Yue Yang. Yue Yang served as general for Wei Marquis Wen, attacking and taking Zhongshan. Wei Marquis Wen enfeoffed Yue Yang with Lingshou. Yue Yang died and was buried in Lingshou. His descendants settled there. Zhongshan was restored as a state, then during Zhao King Wuling's time Zhongshan was destroyed again. The Yue clan later produced Yue Yi.

sentences.zh: 樂毅賢，好兵，趙人舉之。

translations.literal: Yue Yi worthy, fond of military, Zhao people recommended him.
translations.idiomatic: Yue Yi was worthy and fond of military affairs, the people of Zhao recommended him.

sentences.zh: 及武靈王有沙丘之亂，乃去趙適魏。

translations.literal: When Wu Ling Wang had Shaqiu rebellion, then left Zhao went to Wei.
translations.idiomatic: When Wu Ling Wang had the Shaqiu rebellion, he left Zhao and went to Wei.

sentences.zh: 聞燕昭王以子之之亂而齊大敗燕，燕昭王怨齊，未嘗一日而忘報齊也。

translations.literal: Heard Yan Zhao Wang due to Zi Zhi rebellion yet Qi greatly defeated Yan, Yan Zhao Wang resented Qi, never one day forgot avenge Qi.
translations.idiomatic: He heard that Yan Zhao Wang, due to the Zi Zhi rebellion, had been greatly defeated by Qi, Yan Zhao Wang resented Qi, never for a single day forgetting to avenge Qi.

sentences.zh: 燕國小，辟遠，力不能制，於是屈身下士，先禮郭隗以招賢者。

translations.literal: Yan state small, remote, strength could not control, thus humbled self treated scholars with respect, first honored Guo Wei to attract worthy men.
translations.idiomatic: Yan was small and remote, its strength could not control matters, thus he humbled himself and treated scholars with respect, first honoring Guo Wei to attract worthy men.

sentences.zh: 樂毅於是為魏昭王使於燕，燕王以客禮待之。

translations.literal: Yue Yi thus served as Wei Zhao Wang envoy to Yan, Yan king treated him with guest courtesy.
translations.idiomatic: Yue Yi thus served as envoy from Wei Zhao Wang to Yan, the Yan king treated him with guest courtesy.

sentences.zh: 樂毅辭讓，遂委質為臣，燕昭王以為亞卿，久之。

translations.literal: Yue Yi declined modestly, then submitted allegiance as minister, Yan Zhao Wang appointed as vice minister, long time.
translations.idiomatic: Yue Yi declined modestly, then submitted his allegiance as minister, Yan Zhao Wang appointed him as vice minister, and after a long time.

translations.literal: Yue Yi was worthy and fond of military affairs. Zhao recommended him. When King Wuling had the Shagiu uprising, Yue Yi left Zhao and went to Wei. He heard that Yan King Zhao, because of the defeat at Zishi where Qi greatly defeated Yan, harbored resentment toward Qi and never forgot revenge against Qi for a single day. Yan was small and remote, lacking the strength to contend. Thus the king humbled himself and treated scholars with respect, first honoring Guo Wei to attract the worthy. Yue Yi then served as Wei King Zhao's envoy to Yan. The Yan king treated him with guest courtesy. Yue Yi declined modestly, then pledged loyalty as a minister. Yan King Zhao appointed him second minister. This continued for some time.

sentences.zh: 當是時，齊湣王彊，南敗楚相唐眛於重丘，西摧三晉於觀津，遂與三晉擊秦，助趙滅中山，破宋，廣地千餘里。

translations.literal: At this time, Qi Min Wang strong, south defeated Chu chancellor Tang Mai at Chongqiu, west crushed three Jin at Guanjin, then with three Jin attacked Qin, aided Zhao extinguished Zhongshan, broke Song, expanded territory thousand plus li.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Qi Min Wang was strong, south he defeated Chu chancellor Tang Mai at Chongqiu, west he crushed the three Jin at Guanjin, then together with the three Jin attacked Qin, aided Zhao in extinguishing Zhongshan, broke Song, expanded territory a thousand plus li.

sentences.zh: 與秦昭王爭重為帝，已而復歸之。

translations.literal: Contended with Qin Zhao Wang for precedence as emperor, then again returned it.
translations.idiomatic: He contended with Qin Zhao Wang for precedence as emperor, but then returned it.

sentences.zh: 諸侯皆欲背秦而服於齊。

translations.literal: Feudal lords all wished turn from Qin submit to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: The feudal lords all wished to turn from Qin and submit to Qi.

sentences.zh: 湣王自矜，百姓弗堪。

translations.literal: Min Wang arrogant, common people could not bear.
translations.idiomatic: Min Wang was arrogant, the common people could not bear it.

sentences.zh: 於是燕昭王問伐齊之事。

translations.literal: Thus Yan Zhao Wang inquired attack Qi matters.
translations.idiomatic: Thus Yan Zhao Wang inquired about attacking Qi matters.

sentences.zh: 樂毅對曰：「齊，霸國之餘業也，地大人眾，未易獨攻也。

translations.literal: Yue Yi replied: 'Qi is hegemon state remaining enterprise, territory large people many, not easy attack alone.
translations.idiomatic: Yue Yi replied: 'Qi is the remaining enterprise of a hegemon state, territory large and people many, not easy to attack alone.

sentences.zh: 王必欲伐之，莫如與趙及楚、魏。」

translations.literal: If wang must attack it, better ally with Zhao and Chu, Wei.'
translations.idiomatic: If Your Majesty must attack it, better to ally with Zhao and Chu, Wei.'

sentences.zh: 於是使樂毅約趙惠文王，別使連楚、魏，令趙嚪說秦以伐齊之利。

translations.literal: Thus sent Yue Yi ally with Zhao Hui Wen Wang, separate envoys connect Chu, Wei, ordered Zhao Yan persuade Qin of attacking Qi advantages.
translations.idiomatic: Thus he sent Yue Yi to make alliance with Zhao Hui Wen Wang, separately sent envoys to connect with Chu and Wei, ordered Zhao Yan to persuade Qin of the advantages of attacking Qi.

sentences.zh: 諸侯害齊湣王之驕暴，皆爭合從與燕伐齊。

translations.literal: Feudal lords hated Qi Min Wang arrogant tyranny, all contended form vertical alliances with Yan attack Qi.
translations.idiomatic: The feudal lords hated Qi Min Wang's arrogant tyranny, all contended to form vertical alliances with Yan to attack Qi.

sentences.zh: 樂毅還報，燕昭王悉起兵，使樂毅為上將軍，趙惠文王以相國印授樂毅。

translations.literal: Yue Yi returned reported, Yan Zhao Wang mobilized all troops, made Yue Yi supreme general, Zhao Hui Wen Wang bestowed chancellor seal on Yue Yi.
translations.idiomatic: Yue Yi returned and reported, Yan Zhao Wang mobilized all troops, made Yue Yi supreme general, Zhao Hui Wen Wang bestowed the chancellor seal on Yue Yi.

sentences.zh: 樂毅於是并護趙、楚、韓、魏、燕之兵以伐齊，破之濟西。

translations.literal: Yue Yi thus combined commanded Zhao, Chu, Han, Wei, Yan troops to attack Qi, broke them west of Ji.
translations.idiomatic: Yue Yi thus combined and commanded the troops of Zhao, Chu, Han, Wei, Yan to attack Qi, broke them west of Ji.

sentences.zh: 諸侯兵罷歸，而燕軍樂毅獨追，至于臨菑。

translations.literal: Feudal lords troops withdrew returned, yet Yan army Yue Yi alone pursued, reaching Linzi.
translations.idiomatic: The feudal lords' troops withdrew and returned, yet Yan's army under Yue Yi alone pursued, reaching Linzi.

sentences.zh: 齊湣王之敗濟西，亡走，保於莒。

translations.literal: Qi Min Wang defeat west of Ji, fled, took refuge at Ju.
translations.idiomatic: Qi Min Wang's defeat west of Ji, fled, took refuge at Ju.

sentences.zh: 樂毅獨留徇齊，齊皆城守。

translations.literal: Yue Yi alone remained campaigning Qi, Qi all defended cities.
translations.idiomatic: Yue Yi alone remained campaigning in Qi, Qi all defended their cities.

sentences.zh: 樂毅攻入臨菑，盡取齊寶財物祭器輸之燕。

translations.literal: Yue Yi attacked entered Linzi, took all Qi precious treasures ritual vessels transported to Yan.
translations.idiomatic: Yue Yi attacked and entered Linzi, took all Qi's precious treasures and ritual vessels and transported them to Yan.

sentences.zh: 燕昭王大說，親至濟上勞軍，行賞饗士，封樂毅於昌國，號為昌國君。

translations.literal: Yan Zhao Wang greatly delighted, personally went to Ji reward army, distributed rewards feasted soldiers, enfeoffed Yue Yi at Changguo, numbered as Changguo Jun.
translations.idiomatic: Yan Zhao Wang greatly delighted, personally went to the Ji to reward the army, distributed rewards and feasted the soldiers, enfeoffed Yue Yi at Changguo, numbered as Changguo Jun.

sentences.zh: 於是燕昭王收齊鹵獲以歸，而使樂毅復以兵平齊城之不下者。

translations.literal: Thus Yan Zhao Wang collected Qi booty returned, yet sent Yue Yi again with troops pacify Qi cities not submitted.
translations.idiomatic: Thus Yan Zhao Wang collected Qi's booty and returned, yet sent Yue Yi again with troops to pacify Qi's cities that had not submitted.

translations.literal: At this time, Qi King Min was strong. South he defeated Chu prime minister Tang Mai at Chongqiu, west he crushed the three Jin at Guanjin, then allied with the three Jin to attack Qin, helped Zhao destroy Zhongshan, broke Song, expanding territory over a thousand li. He contended with Qin King Zhao to be emperor, but later abandoned it. The feudal lords all wished to turn from Qin and submit to Qi. King Min was arrogant. The people could not bear it. Thus Yan King Zhao inquired about attacking Qi. Yue Yi replied: 'Qi is the remaining enterprise of a hegemon state, with vast territory and large population—not easy to attack alone. If Your Majesty wishes to attack it, nothing better than allying with Zhao and Chu, Wei.' Thus he sent Yue Yi to make treaty with Zhao King Huiwen, separately sent envoys to connect with Chu and Wei, ordering Zhao to persuade Qin of the advantages of attacking Qi. The feudal lords hated Qi King Min's arrogance and tyranny, all competed to form alliance with Yan to attack Qi. Yue Yi returned and reported. Yan King Zhao mobilized all troops, making Yue Yi supreme general. Zhao King Huiwen granted Yue Yi the prime minister seal. Yue Yi thus combined and commanded the troops of Zhao, Chu, Han, Wei, Yan to attack Qi, defeating them west of Ji. The allied troops withdrew and returned, but Yan's army under Yue Yi alone pursued, reaching Linzi. Qi King Min's defeat west of Ji caused him to flee and defend Ju. Yue Yi alone remained to campaign in Qi. Qi all defended their cities. Yue Yi attacked and entered Linzi, taking all Qi's treasures, valuables, and sacrificial vessels, transporting them to Yan. Yan King Zhao was greatly pleased, personally came to Ji to reward the army, distribute rewards and feast the soldiers, enfeoffing Yue Yi at Changguo, titled Lord Changguo. Thus Yan King Zhao took the Qi captives and spoils back, while ordering Yue Yi to again use troops to pacify the Qi cities that had not surrendered.

sentences.zh: 樂毅留徇齊五歲，下齊七十餘城，皆為郡縣以屬燕，唯獨莒、即墨未服。

translations.literal: Yue Yi remained campaigning Qi five years, took seventy plus Qi cities, all made commanderies counties belonging Yan, only Ju, Jimo remained unsubdued.
translations.idiomatic: Yue Yi remained campaigning in Qi five years, took seventy plus Qi cities, all made into commanderies and counties belonging to Yan, only Ju and Jimo remained unsubdued.

sentences.zh: 會燕昭王死，子立為燕惠王。

translations.literal: It happened Yan Zhao Wang died, son ascended as Yan Hui Wang.
translations.idiomatic: It happened that Yan Zhao Wang died, his son ascended as Yan Hui Wang.

sentences.zh: 惠王自為太子時嘗不快於樂毅，及即位，齊之田單聞之，乃縱反閒於燕，曰：「齊城不下者兩城耳。

translations.literal: Hui Wang when crown prince once disliked Yue Yi, upon ascending throne, Qi Tian Dan heard, then spread reverse rumors Yan: 'Qi unsubdued cities only two cities.
translations.idiomatic: Hui Wang, when he was crown prince, once disliked Yue Yi, and upon ascending the throne, Qi's Tian Dan heard this, then spread reverse rumors in Yan, saying: 'Qi's unsubdued cities are only two cities.

sentences.zh: 然所以不早拔者，聞樂毅與燕新王有隙，欲連兵且留齊，南面而王齊。

translations.literal: However reason not early surrender was hearing Yue Yi had rift with Yan new king, wished connect troops remain Qi, face south be king Qi.
translations.idiomatic: However the reason they did not surrender early was hearing that Yue Yi had a rift with Yan's new king, wished to connect troops and remain in Qi, facing south to be king of Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊之所患，唯恐他將之來。」

translations.literal: Qi what feared only other generals coming.''
translations.idiomatic: What Qi feared was only other generals coming.''

sentences.zh: 於是燕惠王固已疑樂毅，得齊反閒，乃使騎劫代將，而召樂毅。

translations.literal: Thus Yan Hui Wang was already suspicious Yue Yi, got Qi reverse rumors, then sent Qi Jie replace general, summoned Yue Yi.
translations.idiomatic: Thus Yan Hui Wang was already suspicious of Yue Yi, got Qi's reverse rumors, then sent Qi Jie to replace the general, and summoned Yue Yi.

sentences.zh: 樂毅知燕惠王之不善代之，畏誅，遂西降趙。

translations.literal: Yue Yi knew Yan Hui Wang replacement not good, feared execution, thus west surrendered Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: Yue Yi knew Yan Hui Wang's replacement was not good, feared execution, thus went west and surrendered to Zhao.

sentences.zh: 趙封樂毅於觀津，號曰望諸君。

translations.literal: Zhao enfeoffed Yue Yi at Guanjin, numbered Wangzhu Jun.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao enfeoffed Yue Yi at Guanjin, numbered as Wangzhu Jun.

sentences.zh: 尊寵樂毅以警動於燕、齊。

translations.literal: Honored favored Yue Yi to alert move Yan, Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Honored and favored Yue Yi to alert and move Yan and Qi.

translations.literal: Yue Yi remained campaigning in Qi for five years, taking over seventy Qi cities, all made into commanderies and counties belonging to Yan. Only Ju and Jimu remained unsubdued. Yan King Zhao died, his son ascended as Yan King Hui. King Hui, when he was crown prince, had once been displeased with Yue Yi. Upon ascending, Qi's Tian Dan heard of this and spread false rumors in Yan: 'The Qi cities not fallen are only two. Yet the reason they are not quickly taken is that Yue Yi has a rift with Yan's new king, wishing to join forces and remain in Qi, facing south to become king of Qi. What Qi fears most is another general coming.' Thus Yan King Hui was already suspicious of Yue Yi. Receiving Qi's false rumors, he sent Ji Jie to replace the general and summoned Yue Yi. Yue Yi knew Yan King Hui did not properly replace him, feared execution, thus surrendered west to Zhao. Zhao enfeoffed Yue Yi at Guanjin, titled Lord Wangzhu. Zhao honored and favored Yue Yi to threaten Yan and Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊田單後與騎劫戰，果設詐誑燕軍，遂破騎劫於即墨下，而轉戰逐燕，北至河上，盡復得齊城，而迎襄王於莒，入于臨菑。

translations.literal: Later Qi Tian Dan battled Qi Jie, indeed set deception tricked Yan army, thus broke Qi Jie below Jimo, turning battle drove Yan, north to river, completely recovered Qi cities, welcomed King Xiang at Ju, entered Linzi.
translations.idiomatic: Later Qi's Tian Dan battled with Qi Jie, indeed set deception to trick Yan army, thus broke Qi Jie below Jimo, and turning battle drove Yan, north to the river, completely recovered Qi cities, and welcomed King Xiang at Ju, entered Linzi.

translations.literal: Later Qi's Tian Dan battled Ji Jie, indeed used deception to trick the Yan army, defeating Ji Jie below Jimu, then turned and fought, pursuing Yan north to the Yellow River, recovering all Qi cities, welcoming King Xiang at Ju, entering Linzi.

sentences.zh: 燕惠王後悔使騎劫代樂毅，以故破軍亡將失齊；

translations.literal: Yan Hui Wang later regretted sending Qi Jie replace Yue Yi, because of this army broken generals lost Qi lost;
translations.idiomatic: Yan Hui Wang later regretted sending Qi Jie to replace Yue Yi, because of this the army was broken, generals lost, Qi lost;

sentences.zh: 又怨樂毅之降趙，恐趙用樂毅而乘燕之獘以伐燕。

translations.literal: Again resented Yue Yi surrender Zhao, feared Zhao use Yue Yi take advantage Yan defeat attack Yan.
translations.idiomatic: Again resented Yue Yi's surrender to Zhao, feared Zhao would use Yue Yi and take advantage of Yan's defeat to attack Yan.

sentences.zh: 燕惠王乃使人讓樂毅，且謝之曰：「先王舉國而委將軍，將軍為燕破齊，報先王之讎，天下莫不震動，寡人豈敢一日而忘將軍之功哉！

translations.literal: Yan Hui Wang then sent person reproach Yue Yi, apologized saying: 'Former king entrusted entire state general, general broke Qi for Yan, avenged former king enmity, world not unshaken, how dare I forget general merit even one day!
translations.idiomatic: Yan Hui Wang then sent someone to reproach Yue Yi, and apologized saying: 'The former king entrusted the entire state to the general, the general broke Qi for Yan, avenged the former king's enmity, the world was not unshaken, how dare I forget the general's merit for even one day!

sentences.zh: 會先王棄群臣，寡人新即位，左右誤寡人。

translations.literal: It happened former king abandoned ministers, I newly ascended throne, attendants misled me.
translations.idiomatic: It happened the former king abandoned the ministers, I newly ascended the throne, my attendants misled me.

sentences.zh: 寡人之使騎劫代將軍，為將軍久暴露於外，故召將軍且休，計事。

translations.literal: My sending Qi Jie replace general was general long exposed abroad, thus summoned general rest plan affairs.
translations.idiomatic: My sending Qi Jie to replace the general was because the general had long been exposed abroad, thus summoned the general to rest and plan affairs.

sentences.zh: 將軍過聽，以與寡人有隙，遂捐燕歸趙。

translations.literal: General mistakenly listened, taking it had rift with me, thus abandoned Yan went Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: The general mistakenly listened, taking it that he had a rift with me, thus abandoned Yan and went to Zhao.

sentences.zh: 將軍自為計則可矣，而亦何以報先王之所以遇將軍之意乎？」

translations.literal: General planning for self acceptable, but how also repay former king intentions treating general?
translations.idiomatic: The general planning for himself is acceptable, but how also to repay the former king's intentions in treating the general?'

sentences.zh: 樂毅報遺燕惠王書曰：

translations.literal: Yue Yi replied sent Yan Hui Wang letter saying:
translations.idiomatic: Yue Yi replied by sending Yan Hui Wang a letter saying:

translations.literal: Yan King Hui later regretted replacing Yue Yi with Ji Jie, thus causing the army to break, generals lost, Qi lost. He also resented Yue Yi's surrender to Zhao, fearing Zhao would use Yue Yi to take advantage of Yan's weakness to attack Yan. Yan King Hui sent someone to reproach Yue Yi and apologize: 'The former king entrusted the entire state to the general. The general broke Qi for Yan, avenged the former king's grudge. The world all trembled. How dare I forget the general's merit for a single day! The former king abandoned the ministers, I newly ascended. My attendants misled me. My sending Ji Jie to replace the general was because the general had long been exposed abroad, thus summoning the general to rest and discuss plans. The general misheard, thinking I had a rift with you, thus abandoning Yan for Zhao. The general planning for himself is acceptable, but how do you repay the former king's treatment of the general?' Yue Yi sent a letter in reply to Yan King Hui:

sentences.zh: 臣不佞，不能奉承王命，以順左右之心，恐傷先王之明，有害足下之義，故遁逃走趙。

translations.literal: Minister not talented, could not accept wang command, to comply attendants hearts, feared harming former king wisdom, harming majesty righteousness, thus fled went Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: Your minister is not talented, could not accept Your Majesty's command, to comply with the hearts of those around you, feared harming the former king's wisdom, harming Your Majesty's righteousness, thus fled and went to Zhao.

sentences.zh: 今足下使人數之以罪，臣恐侍御者不察先王之所以畜幸臣之理，又不白臣之所以事先王之心，故敢以書對。

translations.literal: Now majesty sends people enumerate crimes, minister fears attendants not examine former king reasons nurturing favoring minister, not understand minister heart serving former king, thus dares respond with letter.
translations.idiomatic: Now Your Majesty sends people to enumerate my crimes, your minister fears the attendants do not examine the former king's reasons for nurturing and favoring your minister, and do not understand your minister's heart in serving the former king, thus dares to respond with a letter.

translations.literal: I am unworthy, could not follow Your Majesty's commands to comply with the attendants' wishes, fearing to harm the former king's wisdom and injure Your Majesty's righteousness, thus fled to Zhao. Now Your Majesty sends people to enumerate my crimes. I fear the attendants do not examine the former king's reasons for raising and favoring me, nor understand my intentions in serving the former king, thus dare to reply in writing.

sentences.zh: 臣聞賢聖之君不以祿私親，其功多者賞之，其能當者處之。

translations.literal: Minister heard worthy sage lords not favor relatives with salary, those merit many reward them, those ability match place them.
translations.idiomatic: Your minister has heard that worthy sage lords do not favor relatives with salary, those with much merit they reward, those whose ability matches they place.

sentences.zh: 故察能而授官者，成功之君也；

translations.literal: Thus examine ability grant office, successful lords;
translations.idiomatic: Thus those who examine ability and grant office are successful lords;

sentences.zh: 論行而結交者，立名之士也。

translations.literal: Discuss conduct form friendships, establish name scholars.
translations.idiomatic: Those who discuss conduct and form friendships are scholars who establish names.

sentences.zh: 臣竊觀先王之舉也，見有高世主之心，故假節於魏，以身得察於燕。

translations.literal: Minister secretly observed former king actions, saw had transcend age lord heart, thus borrowed credentials Wei, to have person examined Yan.
translations.idiomatic: Your minister secretly observed the former king's actions, saw he had the heart of a lord transcending the age, thus borrowed credentials from Wei, to have his person examined by Yan.

sentences.zh: 先王過舉，廁之賓客之中，立之群臣之上，不謀父兄，以為亞卿。

translations.literal: Former king over-elevated, placed among guests, established above ministers, not consulted father brothers, made vice minister.
translations.idiomatic: The former king over-elevated, placed him among the guests, established him above the ministers, did not consult father and brothers, made him vice minister.

sentences.zh: 臣竊不自知，自以為奉令承教，可幸無罪，故受令而不辭。

translations.literal: Minister secretly not know self, thought receiving orders accepting teachings, might fortunately without crime, thus accepted orders without declining.
translations.idiomatic: Your minister secretly did not know himself, thought receiving orders and accepting teachings, might fortunately be without crime, thus accepted orders without declining.

translations.literal: I have heard that worthy and sage lords do not favor relatives with stipends. Those with great merit they reward, those capable they place. Therefore examining ability and granting office is a lord who achieves success. Discussing conduct and forming friendships is a scholar who establishes reputation. I secretly observed the former king's actions, saw his heart surpassed the lords of the age, thus borrowed credentials from Wei to personally be examined in Yan. The former king mistakenly promoted me, placing me among the guests, establishing me above the ministers, not consulting father or brothers, appointing me second minister. I secretly did not understand myself, thinking I followed commands and teachings, could fortunately avoid crime, thus accepted the command without declining.

sentences.zh: 先王命之曰：「我有積怨深怒於齊，不量輕弱，而欲以齊為事。」

translations.literal: Former king commanded saying: 'I have accumulated resentment deep anger toward Qi, not measure lightness weakness, wish make Qi affair.'
translations.idiomatic: The former king commanded him saying: 'I have accumulated resentment and deep anger toward Qi, do not measure my lightness and weakness, wish to make Qi my affair.'

sentences.zh: 臣曰：「夫齊，霸國之餘業而最勝之遺事也。

translations.literal: Minister said: 'As for Qi, hegemon state remaining enterprise most victorious legacy.
translations.idiomatic: Your minister said: 'As for Qi, it is the remaining enterprise of a hegemon state and the legacy of the most victorious.

sentences.zh: 練於兵甲，習於戰攻。

translations.literal: Trained armor weapons, practiced battle attack.
translations.idiomatic: Trained in armor and weapons, practiced in battle and attack.

sentences.zh: 王若欲伐之，必與天下圖之。

translations.literal: Wang if wish attack it, must with world plan it.
translations.idiomatic: If Your Majesty wishes to attack it, must plan with the world.

sentences.zh: 與天下圖之，莫若結於趙。

translations.literal: With world plan it, better ally Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: To plan with the world, better than allying with Zhao.

sentences.zh: 且又淮北、宋地，楚魏之所欲也，趙若許而約四國攻之，齊可大破也。」

translations.literal: Moreover Huai north, Song lands, Chu Wei what desire, Zhao if agree ally four states attack it, Qi can greatly broken.''
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, Huai north and Song lands are what Chu and Wei desire, if Zhao agrees and allies four states to attack it, Qi can be greatly broken.''

sentences.zh: 先王以為然，具符節南使臣於趙。

translations.literal: Former king considered right, prepared credentials south sent minister Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: The former king considered it right, prepared credentials and south sent your minister to Zhao.

sentences.zh: 顧反命，起兵擊齊。

translations.literal: Turned back reported, raised troops attacked Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Turned back and reported, raised troops to attack Qi.

sentences.zh: 以天之道，先王之靈，河北之地隨先王而舉之濟上。

translations.literal: With heaven way, former king spirit, Hebei lands followed former king raised at Ji.
translations.idiomatic: With the way of heaven, the former king's spirit, the lands north of the river followed the former king and raised them at Ji.

sentences.zh: 濟上之軍受命擊齊，大敗齊人。

translations.literal: Ji army received orders attacked Qi, greatly defeated Qi people.
translations.idiomatic: The Ji army received orders to attack Qi, greatly defeated the Qi people.

sentences.zh: 輕卒銳兵，長驅至國。

translations.literal: Light troops sharp weapons, long drove to capital.
translations.idiomatic: Light troops sharp weapons, long drove to the capital.

sentences.zh: 齊王遁而走莒，僅以身免；

translations.literal: Qi king fled went Ju, barely escaped with body;
translations.idiomatic: The Qi king fled and went to Ju, barely escaped with his life;

sentences.zh: 珠玉財寶車甲珍器盡收入于燕。

translations.literal: Pearls jade treasures chariots armor precious vessels all entered Yan.
translations.idiomatic: Pearls jade treasures chariots armor precious vessels all entered Yan.

sentences.zh: 齊器設於寧臺，大呂陳於元英，故鼎反乎磿室，薊丘之植植於汶篁，自五伯已來，功未有及先王者也。

translations.literal: Qi vessels set Ning Terrace, Da Lu displayed Yuan Ying, ancient tripods returned Ao chamber, Jiqiu plants planted Wen Huang, since five hegemons, merit not equaled former king.
translations.idiomatic: Qi vessels set up at Ning Terrace, Da Lu displayed at Yuan Ying, ancient tripods returned to Ao chamber, Jiqiu's plants planted at Wen Huang, since the five hegemons, merit has not equaled the former king.

sentences.zh: 先王以為慊於志，故裂地而封之，使得比小國諸侯。

translations.literal: Former king considered satisfying ambitions, thus split land enfeoffed him, allowed compare small state feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: The former king considered it satisfying to his ambitions, thus split land and enfeoffed him, allowing him to compare to small state feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 臣竊不自知，自以為奉命承教，可幸無罪，是以受命不辭。

translations.literal: Minister secretly not know self, thought receiving orders accepting teachings, might fortunately without crime, thus accepted orders without declining.
translations.idiomatic: Your minister secretly did not know himself, thought receiving orders accepting teachings, might fortunately be without crime, thus accepted orders without declining.

translations.literal: The former king commanded me: 'I have accumulated resentment and deep anger toward Qi, not measuring my weakness, wishing to make Qi my affair.' I said: 'Qi is the remaining enterprise of a hegemon state and the legacy of the most victorious. Skilled in armor and weapons, practiced in battle and attack. If Your Majesty wishes to attack it, must plan with the world. Planning with the world, nothing better than allying with Zhao. Moreover Huai north and Song territory are what Chu and Wei desire. If Zhao agrees and unites the four states to attack, Qi can be greatly broken.' The former king considered it correct, prepared tallies and credentials, sending me south as envoy to Zhao. Returning with the reply, raised troops to attack Qi. By heaven's way and the former king's spirit, the lands north of the Yellow River followed the former king and were raised at Ji. The army at Ji received command to attack Qi, greatly defeating the Qi people. Light troops and sharp soldiers drove straight to the capital. The Qi king fled to Ju, barely escaping with his life. Pearls, jade, treasures, carriages, armor, precious vessels—all entered Yan. Qi vessels displayed at Ning Terrace, great bells arrayed at Yuan Ying, ancient tripods returned to the stone chamber, Jizhou plants planted at Wen bamboo—from the Five Hegemons onward, none achieved merit matching the former king. The former king was satisfied in his ambitions, thus divided land to enfeoff him, allowing him to equal the small state feudal lords. I secretly did not understand myself, thinking I followed commands and teachings, could fortunately avoid crime, thus accepted the command without declining.

sentences.zh: 臣聞賢聖之君，功立而不廢，故著於春秋；

translations.literal: Minister heard worthy sage lords, merit established not abandoned, thus recorded Spring Autumn;
translations.idiomatic: Your minister has heard that worthy sage lords establish merit and do not abandon it, thus are recorded in the Spring and Autumn;

sentences.zh: 蚤知之士，名成而不毀，故稱於後世。

translations.literal: Early knowing scholars, name established not destroyed, thus praised later generations.
translations.idiomatic: Early knowing scholars establish names and do not destroy them, thus are praised in later generations.

sentences.zh: 若先王之報怨雪恥，夷萬乘之彊國，收八百歲之蓄積，及至棄群臣之日，餘教未衰，執政任事之臣，修法令，慎庶孽，施及乎萌隸，皆可以教後世。

translations.literal: As for former king avenging resentment washing shame, leveling ten thousand chariot strong states, collecting eight hundred years accumulation, to day abandoned ministers, remaining teachings not declined, governing administering affairs ministers, repairing law commands, careful numerous descendants, extending sprouting servants, all can teach later generations.
translations.idiomatic: As for the former king's avenging resentment and washing away shame, leveling ten thousand chariot strong states, collecting eight hundred years of accumulation, and to the day he abandoned the ministers, his remaining teachings not declined, the governing ministers administering affairs, repairing law commands, careful with numerous descendants, extending to the sprouting servants, all can teach later generations.

translations.literal: I have heard that worthy and sage lords establish merit without abandoning it, thus recorded in the Spring and Autumn Annals. Scholars who early understand establish fame without destroying it, thus praised in later generations. Like the former king's revenge and washing away shame, leveling a ten thousand chariot strong state, collecting eight hundred years of accumulations—until the day he abandoned his ministers, his remaining teachings did not decline. The governing ministers who handle affairs refine laws and commands, are cautious with heirs, extend to the lowest servants—all can instruct later generations.

sentences.zh: 臣聞之，善作者不必善成，善始者不必善終。

translations.literal: Minister heard, good at beginning not necessarily complete well, good at starting not necessarily end well.
translations.idiomatic: Your minister has heard that those good at beginning do not necessarily complete well, those good at starting do not necessarily end well.

sentences.zh: 昔伍子胥說聽於闔閭，而吳王遠跡至郢；

translations.literal: Formerly Wu Zi Xu persuasion listened He Lu, Wu king far went Ying;
translations.idiomatic: Formerly Wu Zi Xu's persuasion was listened to by He Lu, and the Wu king went far to Ying;

sentences.zh: 夫差弗是也，賜之鴟夷而浮之江。

translations.literal: Fu Cha not like this, granted leather bag floated river.
translations.idiomatic: Fu Cha was not like this, granted him a leather bag and floated him on the river.

sentences.zh: 吳王不寤先論之可以立功，故沈子胥而不悔；

translations.literal: Wu king not awaken earlier advice can establish merit, thus drowned Zi Xu not regret;
translations.idiomatic: The Wu king did not awaken to the earlier advice that could establish merit, thus drowned Zi Xu and did not regret;

sentences.zh: 子胥不蚤見主之不同量，是以至於入江而不化。

translations.literal: Zi Xu not early see lord different capacities, thus came to entering river not dissolving.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Xu did not early see that his lord had different capacities, thus came to entering the river and not dissolving.

translations.literal: I have heard that those skilled at beginning are not necessarily skilled at completing, those good at starting are not necessarily good at ending. In former times Wu Zixu advised Helu and was heeded, Wu king far reached Ying. Fuchai did not follow this, granted him the owl stomach and floated him on the river. Wu king did not realize the earlier advice could establish merit, thus drowned Zixu without regret. Zixu did not early see his lord's different measure, thus reached floating on the river without change.

sentences.zh: 夫免身立功，以明先王之跡，臣之上計也。

translations.literal: Escaping body establishing merit, to clarify former king traces, minister highest plan.
translations.idiomatic: Escaping the body and establishing merit, to clarify the former king's traces, is your minister's highest plan.

sentences.zh: 離毀辱之誹謗，墮先王之名，臣之所大恐也。

translations.literal: Separating slander humiliation defamation, destroying former king name, minister greatly fears.
translations.idiomatic: Separating from slander and humiliation, destroying the former king's name, is what your minister greatly fears.

sentences.zh: 臨不測之罪，以幸為利，義之所不敢出也。

translations.literal: Facing unpredictable crimes, taking fortune as profit, righteousness not dare go out.
translations.idiomatic: Facing unpredictable crimes, taking fortune as profit, righteousness does not dare go out.

translations.literal: Saving myself and establishing merit to illuminate the former king's traces—this is my highest plan. Avoiding slanders of destruction and disgrace, tarnishing the former king's name—this is my great fear. Facing unpredictable crime to seek personal profit—righteousness does not dare go there.

sentences.zh: 臣聞古之君子，交絕不出惡聲；

translations.literal: Minister heard ancient gentlemen, friendships end not issue evil sounds;
translations.idiomatic: Your minister has heard that ancient gentlemen, when friendships end, do not issue evil sounds;

sentences.zh: 忠臣去國，不絜其名。

translations.literal: Loyal ministers leaving states, not purify their names.
translations.idiomatic: Loyal ministers leaving their states do not purify their names.

sentences.zh: 臣雖不佞，數奉教於君子矣。

translations.literal: Minister though not talented, several times received teachings gentlemen.
translations.idiomatic: Your minister though not talented, has several times received teachings from gentlemen.

sentences.zh: 恐侍御者之親左右之說，不察疏遠之行，故敢獻書以聞，唯君王之留意焉。

translations.literal: Fearing attendants favoring close by words, not examining distant conduct, thus dares offer letter report, only Your Majesty attention.
translations.idiomatic: Fearing the attendants' favoring the words of those close by, not examining distant conduct, thus dares to offer this letter to report, only Your Majesty's attention.

translations.literal: I have heard that ancient gentlemen, when friendship ends, do not speak ill. Loyal ministers leaving their state do not cleanse their names. Though I am unworthy, I have repeatedly received teachings from gentlemen. I fear the attendants favor the close attendants' words, do not examine distant conduct, thus dare to present this letter to inform. May Your Majesty pay attention.

sentences.zh: 於是燕王復以樂毅子樂閒為昌國君；

translations.literal: Thus Yan king again made Yue Yi son Yue Xian Changguo Jun;
translations.idiomatic: Thus the Yan king again made Yue Yi's son Yue Xian the Changguo Jun;

sentences.zh: 而樂毅往來復通燕，燕、趙以為客卿。

translations.literal: Yue Yi came went again communicated Yan, Yan Zhao made guest minister.
translations.idiomatic: And Yue Yi came and went again communicating with Yan, Yan and Zhao made him guest minister.

sentences.zh: 樂毅卒於趙。

translations.literal: Yue Yi died in Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: Yue Yi died in Zhao.

translations.literal: Thus Yan king again made Yue Yi's son Yue Xian Lord Changguo. Yue Yi traveled back and forth maintaining relations with Yan. Yan and Zhao employed him as guest minister. Yue Yi died in Zhao.

sentences.zh: 樂閒居燕三十餘年，燕王喜用其相栗腹之計，欲攻趙，而問昌國君樂閒。

translations.literal: Yue Xian dwelt Yan thirty plus years, Yan king happily used chancellor Li Fu plans, wished attack Zhao, asked Changguo Jun Yue Xian.
translations.idiomatic: Yue Xian dwelt in Yan thirty plus years, the Yan king happily used his chancellor Li Fu's plans, wished to attack Zhao, and asked Changguo Jun Yue Xian.

sentences.zh: 樂閒曰：「趙，四戰之國也，其民習兵，伐之不可。」

translations.literal: Yue Xian said: 'Zhao four battle country, people practiced military, attacking not possible.'
translations.idiomatic: Yue Xian said: 'Zhao is a four-battle country, its people are practiced in military affairs, attacking it is not possible.'

sentences.zh: 燕王不聽，遂伐趙。

translations.literal: Yan king not listen, thus attacked Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: The Yan king did not listen, thus attacked Zhao.

sentences.zh: 趙使廉頗擊之，大破栗腹之軍於鄗，禽栗腹、樂乘。

translations.literal: Zhao sent Lian Po attacked them, greatly broke Li Fu army at Hao, captured Li Fu, Yue Cheng.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao sent Lian Po to attack them, greatly broke Li Fu's army at Hao, captured Li Fu and Yue Cheng.

sentences.zh: 樂乘者，樂閒之宗也。

translations.literal: Yue Cheng was Yue Xian clan relative.
translations.idiomatic: Yue Cheng was Yue Xian's clan relative.

sentences.zh: 於是樂閒奔趙，趙遂圍燕。

translations.literal: Thus Yue Xian fled Zhao, Zhao then surrounded Yan.
translations.idiomatic: Thus Yue Xian fled to Zhao, Zhao then surrounded Yan.

sentences.zh: 燕重割地以與趙和，趙乃解而去。

translations.literal: Yan heavily cut land to make peace Zhao, Zhao then withdrew left.
translations.idiomatic: Yan heavily cut land to make peace with Zhao, Zhao then withdrew and left.

translations.literal: Yue Xian resided in Yan over thirty years. Yan King Hui favored using his prime minister Li Fu's plans, wishing to attack Zhao, and asked Lord Changguo Yue Xian. Yue Xian said: 'Zhao is a nation of four frontiers, its people practiced in warfare. Attacking it is not possible.' Yan king did not listen, thus attacked Zhao. Zhao sent Lian Po to attack them, greatly defeating Li Fu's army at Gao, capturing Li Fu and Yue Cheng. Yue Cheng was Yue Xian's clan member. Thus Yue Xian fled to Zhao. Zhao then besieged Yan. Yan heavily ceded land to make peace with Zhao. Zhao then withdrew.

sentences.zh: 燕王恨不用樂閒，樂閒既在趙，乃遺樂閒書曰：「紂之時，箕子不用，犯諫不怠，以冀其聽；

translations.literal: Yan king regretted not using Yue Xian, Yue Xian already in Zhao, then sent Yue Xian letter saying: 'Zhou time, Ji Zi not used, offended remonstrance not tiring, to hope listening;
translations.idiomatic: The Yan king regretted not using Yue Xian, Yue Xian already being in Zhao, then sent Yue Xian a letter saying: 'In Zhou's time, Ji Zi was not used, offended remonstrance without tiring, to hope for his listening;

sentences.zh: 商容不達，身祇辱焉，以冀其變。

translations.literal: Shang Rong not understood, body endured humiliation, to hope change.
translations.idiomatic: Shang Rong was not understood, his body endured humiliation, to hope for his change.

sentences.zh: 及民志不入，獄囚自出，然後二子退隱。

translations.literal: When people will not enter, prison prisoners came out themselves, then two retreated hid.
translations.idiomatic: When the people's will did not enter, prison prisoners came out themselves, then the two retreated and hid.

sentences.zh: 故紂負桀暴之累，二子不失忠聖之名。

translations.literal: Thus Zhou bore Jie tyranny burden, two not lost loyal sage names.
translations.idiomatic: Thus Zhou bore Jie tyranny's burden, the two did not lose loyal sage names.

sentences.zh: 何者？

translations.literal: Why?
translations.idiomatic: Why?

sentences.zh: 其憂患之盡矣。

translations.literal: Their worries sufferings exhausted.
translations.idiomatic: Their worries and sufferings were exhausted.

sentences.zh: 今寡人雖愚，不若紂之暴也；

translations.literal: Now though I foolish, not like Zhou tyranny;
translations.idiomatic: Now though I am foolish, not like Zhou's tyranny;

sentences.zh: 燕民雖亂，不若殷民之甚也。

translations.literal: Yan people though chaotic, not like Yin people extremity.
translations.idiomatic: Yan people though chaotic, not like Yin people's extremity.

sentences.zh: 室有語，不相盡，以告鄰里。

translations.literal: Rooms have words, not fully told, to inform neighbors.
translations.idiomatic: Rooms have words, not fully told, to inform neighbors.

sentences.zh: 二者，寡人不為君取也。」

translations.literal: These two, I would not take for lord.''
translations.idiomatic: These two, I would not take for my lord.''

translations.literal: Yan king regretted not using Yue Xian. Yue Xian being in Zhao, sent Yue Xian a letter: 'In Zhou's time, Ji Zi was not used, committed remonstrance without tiring, hoping for his listening. Shang Rong was not accepted, personally endured disgrace, hoping for change. When the people's will did not enter, prisoners released themselves, then the two scholars retired and hid. Thus Zhou bore the burden of Jie-like tyranny, the two scholars did not lose their loyal sage names. Why? Their concern and suffering were complete. Now though I am foolish, not matching Zhou's tyranny. Yan people though in disorder, not matching Yin people's extremity. If the house has words, not fully spoken, to tell the neighbors and villagers. These two, I do not do for my lord.

sentences.zh: 樂閒、樂乘怨燕不聽其計，二人卒留趙。

translations.literal: Yue Xian, Yue Cheng resented Yan not listening plans, two finally stayed Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: Yue Xian and Yue Cheng resented Yan not listening to their plans, the two finally stayed in Zhao.

sentences.zh: 趙封樂乘為武襄君。

translations.literal: Zhao enfeoffed Yue Cheng as Wu Xiang Jun.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao enfeoffed Yue Cheng as Wu Xiang Jun.

translations.literal: Zhao enfeoffed Yue Cheng as Lord Wuxiang. The next year, Yue Cheng and Lian Po besieged Yan for Zhao. Yan used heavy ceremony to make peace, then they withdrew.

sentences.zh: 其明年，樂乘、廉頗為趙圍燕，燕重禮以和，乃解。

translations.literal: Next year, Yue Cheng, Lian Po for Zhao surrounded Yan, Yan heavily bestowed gifts to make peace, then withdrew.
translations.idiomatic: The next year, Yue Cheng and Lian Po for Zhao surrounded Yan, Yan heavily bestowed gifts to make peace, then withdrew.

sentences.zh: 後五歲，趙孝成王卒。

translations.literal: After five years, Zhao Xiao Cheng Wang died.
translations.idiomatic: After five years, Zhao Xiao Cheng Wang died.

sentences.zh: 襄王使樂乘代廉頗。

translations.literal: King Xiang sent Yue Cheng to replace Lian Po.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang sent Yue Cheng to replace Lian Po.

sentences.zh: 廉頗攻樂乘，樂乘走，廉頗亡入魏。

translations.literal: Lian Po attacked Yue Cheng, Yue Cheng fled, Lian Po fled entered Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Lian Po attacked Yue Cheng, Yue Cheng fled, Lian Po fled and entered Wei.

sentences.zh: 其後十六年而秦滅趙。

translations.literal: Thereafter sixteen years Qin extinguished Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: Thereafter sixteen years and Qin extinguished Zhao.

translations.literal: Five years later, Zhao King Xiaocheng died. King Xiang sent Yue Cheng to replace Lian Po. Lian Po attacked Yue Cheng. Yue Cheng fled. Lian Po deserted to Wei. Sixteen years later Qin destroyed Zhao. Over twenty years later, Gaozu passed through Zhao and asked: 'Does Yue Yi have descendants?'

sentences.zh: 其後二十餘年，高帝過趙，問：「樂毅有後世乎？」

translations.literal: Thereafter twenty plus years, Gao Di passed Zhao, asked: 'Yue Yi has descendants?'
translations.idiomatic: Thereafter twenty plus years, Gao Di passed through Zhao, asked: 'Does Yue Yi have descendants?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「有樂叔。」

translations.literal: Replied: 'Has Yue Shu.'
translations.idiomatic: Replied: 'There is Yue Shu.'

sentences.zh: 高帝封之樂卿，號曰華成君。

translations.literal: Gao Di enfeoffed him Yue Qing, numbered Hua Cheng Jun.
translations.idiomatic: Gao Di enfeoffed him as Yue Qing, numbered as Hua Cheng Jun.

sentences.zh: 華成君，樂毅之孫也。

translations.literal: Hua Cheng Jun was Yue Yi grandson.
translations.idiomatic: Hua Cheng Jun was Yue Yi's grandson.

sentences.zh: 而樂氏之族有樂瑕公、樂臣公，趙且為秦所滅，亡之齊高密。

translations.literal: Yue clan had Yue Xia Gong, Yue Chen Gong, Zhao about to be extinguished by Qin, fled Qi Gaomi.
translations.idiomatic: And the Yue clan had Yue Xia Gong, Yue Chen Gong, Zhao was about to be extinguished by Qin, fled to Qi Gaomi.

sentences.zh: 樂臣公善修黃帝、老子之言，顯聞於齊，稱賢師。

translations.literal: Yue Chen Gong skilled cultivating Huang Di, Lao Zi words, famous in Qi, called worthy teacher.
translations.idiomatic: Yue Chen Gong was skilled in cultivating Huang Di and Lao Zi's words, was famous in Qi, called worthy teacher.

translations.literal: They replied: 'There is Yue Shu.' Gaozu enfeoffed him as Lord Yue, titled Lord Huacheng. Lord Huacheng was Yue Yi's grandson. The Yue clan had Lord Yue Xia and Lord Yue Chen. Zhao was about to be destroyed by Qin, they fled to Qi's Gaomi. Lord Yue Chen was skilled in the teachings of Yellow Emperor and Laozi, became famous in Qi, called a worthy teacher. The Grand Historian says: At first, Qi's Kuai Tong and Lord Father Jian read Yue Yi's letter replying to the Yan king, never failed to put down the book and weep.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：始齊之蒯通及主父偃讀樂毅之報燕王書，未嘗不廢書而泣也。

translations.literal: Grand Historian said: When Qi Kuai Tong and Zhu Fu Yan first read Yue Yi letter replying Yan king, never failed put down book weep.
translations.idiomatic: Grand Historian said: When Qi's Kuai Tong and Zhu Fu Yan first read Yue Yi's letter replying to the Yan king, they never failed to put down the book and weep.

sentences.zh: 樂臣公學黃帝、老子，其本師號曰河上丈人，不知其所出。

translations.literal: Yue Chen Gong studied Huang Di, Lao Zi, root teacher called Hesang Zhangren, not knowing origin.
translations.idiomatic: Yue Chen Gong studied Huang Di and Lao Zi, his root teacher was called Hesang Zhangren, not knowing his origin.

sentences.zh: 河上丈人教安期生，安期生教毛翕公，毛翕公教樂瑕公，樂瑕公教樂臣公，樂臣公教蓋公。

translations.literal: Hesang Zhangren taught An Qisheng, An Qisheng taught Mao Xigong, Mao Xigong taught Yue Xiagong, Yue Xiagong taught Yue Chengong, Yue Chengong taught Gai Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Hesang Zhangren taught An Qisheng, An Qisheng taught Mao Xigong, Mao Xigong taught Yue Xiagong, Yue Xiagong taught Yue Chengong, Yue Chengong taught Gai Gong.

sentences.zh: 蓋公教於齊高密、膠西，為曹相國師。

translations.literal: Gai Gong taught in Qi Gaomi, Jiaoxi, was Cao Xiangguo teacher.
translations.idiomatic: Gai Gong taught in Qi Gaomi and Jiaoxi, was Cao Xiangguo's teacher.

translations.literal: Lord Yue Chen studied Yellow Emperor and Laozi. His original teacher was titled Riverbank Elder, no one knows his origin. Riverbank Elder taught An Qisheng, An Qisheng taught Mao Xigong, Mao Xigong taught Lord Yue Xia, Lord Yue Xia taught Lord Yue Chen, Lord Yue Chen taught Gai Gong. Gai Gong taught in Qi's Gaomi and Jiaoxi, became teacher to Chancellor Cao. Gai Gong taught in Qi's Gaomi and Jiaoxi, became teacher to Chancellor Cao.
